sentence.Network_en: They were working frantically in the fear that an aftershock would jolt the house again.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们拼命地干着，担心余震可能会使房子再次受到震动。

sentence.Network_en: They were already under stress, thanks to the aftershock of last year's drought.
sentence.Network_cn: 去年遭受的旱灾让他们心有余悸、倍感忧虑。

sentence.Network_en: The aftershock frequency decreases regularly with time.
sentence.Network_cn: 余震的频度随时间有规律地减少.

entry.def: Aftershocks are smaller earthquakes which occur after a large earthquake.
People sometimes refer to the effects of an important event, especially a bad one, as the aftershock .

example.ex: They were already under stress, thanks to the aftershock of last year's drought.
example.tran: 去年遭受的旱灾让他们心有余悸、倍感忧虑。

means.word_mean: 1. a tremor (or one of a series of tremors) occurring after the main shock of an earthquake
